Reviews.Title: “A very average place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marigot1
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott. We chose the hotel because it was near our family. We had stayed elsewhere for the same price last year and thought that this would be as nice but closer to family. First the positives. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. The negatives: the rooms were much smaller than the hotel we stayed in the prior year. Fortunately we were not in the room much. Second, breakfast is not included... Weird because it's sister hotel is literally right next door and it was less money, same size rooms and did include breakfast. Would we return? We like the area but we will investigate the other options.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Hotel Might Give you a Confirmation, but Not a Room”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoYoungMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a room online at this hotel in August 2011 for a stay in October. We made a minor change to the reservation on the phone two nights before we came, and were sent a confirmation of our reservation, noting the changes. Imagine our unpleasant surprise when we got to the hotel at 8 pm, with our 1 year old, 3 year old and 5 year old in tow, only to be told we didn't have a room. When we showed them the confirmation email from Marriott they said our reservation had been altered at Central Booking and in spite of the fact we had a confirmation email in hand they didn't have any rooms for us and were sold out. That was all. The front desk told us we could call the 800 number but there was nothing else they could do. After an hour talking to various people at Marriott we were told that though they were very sorry this this mistake had been made. They said if another Marriott in the area had any rooms free they would have sent us there, but everything was booked. They did not in any way help us try to find an alternate room for the night at a different hotel. Fortunately I had my computer and was able to find a nearby hotel (the LaQuinta, which was totally fine) on Orbitz. I can't believe they didn't help us find a room. The customer service was terrible from the front desk though the person on the 800 line. On the way to the new hotel I called back to complain about how this was not right, and that person was pretty decent and explained to me how the reservation had been messed up but instead of fixing it or letting me know they just did nothing and left it to me to find out I didn't have a room when I got there. I can understand one mistake being made, but come on. How could it have occurred to no one to find us a room at another hotel? At the end of that call they said they would give us some bonus points (because we are elite rewards members) but that was no help to me when what I needed was a place to stay. I will definitely not stay there again. Total incompetence. The hotel is fine but the I've been staying there since 2007 and after they redesigned it to look like all the other Courtyards all the good staff people there are gone and the old perks like free coffee and cookies in the lobby have been replaced with mostly unfriendly staff and an overpriced snack bar.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Soonipi
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is convenient to the highway and only minutes from U of I campus. There is a shopping mall, several other hotels, and many chain restaurants in the immediate area. If highway noise disturbs you, ask for a room that doesn't face the interstate. It is an unusual Courtyard property. We were surprised at how small our King size room was. The onsite "restaurant/bar" was also a surprise: it resembled the dining area one often finds just off the lobby at a Residence Inn. We ate elsewhere so I can't review the food. Despite being small our room was clean and well-serviced every day. The furnishings were in very good condition. There was plenty of hot water on demand, extra towels upon request, and a coffee pot and small refrigerator in the room. The bed was acceptable. There is a computer in the lobby where you can check-in to flights and print boarding passes. Complimentary coffee is available in the morning, hot water the remainder of the day. Couldn't call it a good value as we were there 3 nights over homecoming weekend and paid $100 more per night than the usual rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: PeterRose14
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Champaign could be a lot better. The lobby and 'bistro' are very similar to every other Courtyard since the brand remodeled in the past couple of years. The food offered is marginal in quality and the cost of items was high for the quality (almost 3 bucks for a coffee). The rooms have been remodeled in the last year or two - on the surface (paint/ tvs/etc) based on the recent updates by the brand. But the rooms themself could use a complete update and remodel. In addition, hallways noise was noticed in the room which suggests that the doors etc have not been updated. The air temperature control was not working properly - either way too cold or way too stuffy. The bed was not very comfortable and sheets didn't seem to fit the bed correctly. The cleanliness of the room was fine and in general it was an alright stay, but I have come to expect more from Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: Paloki80
Reviews.Content: Everything was in good working order. The Lobby, halls and rooms were very clean and well maintained. Internet service was very good. No restaurant but a Starbucks Bistro served very good coffee. Housekeeping was outstanding. Reception was very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Courtyards!”
Reviews.Author: Cburysaint
Reviews.Content: We only stay in Marriott properties when traveling and we do a month long cross country trip every summer. So we end up spending about 10+ nights in Marriott hotels each summer. I love Courtyards for their value and for their comfort. The Courtyard in Champaign is awesome - and not just because it has a Starbucks in the lobby! (certainly a HUGE plus for us though). The rooms are ample. The beds are super comfy, and the hotel has obviously been re-done recently. I asked the woman at the desk about this and she said that the Courtyard policy is to redo a property every 5 years. So they always look fresh, trendy, and new. It works for us! The staff was great. The kids always head straight to the pool no matter what time we arrive, and the Bistro/Bar and Starbucks in the lobby kept the grown ups happy. If the pool were an outdoor pool, this could almost be a destination hotel...Love this property!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Ville - The Best College Sports Town in America
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...very friendly staff....my favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ross_in_Louisville
Reviews.Content: It is all good...nice decor, friendly folks, great location near interstate....shopping and restaurants nearby...

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than most Courtyards”
Reviews.Author: ProfandMom
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Courtyard. The rooms have the newer Courtyard furniture and decor, so everything looks modern. The lobby has been fairly recently redone as well. The restaurant (which we did not try) is a Bistro which has some nice looking options. The lobby is also comfortable for sitting or eating your own food. We had a room with two queens and found that it was fairly large. It had a small refrigerator and plenty of workspace. The beds have nice duvets and were comfortable. The wireless internet worked well in the room. We had no issues with noise. The pool was also very nice and clean. All of the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful, and we asked for and got a late check-out without problems. The hotel is very close to a large mall with all the usual food and shopping options. I would certainly stay here again. Some Courtyards need updating, but this one is one of the better ones. If we are in Champaign again, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: hartfordtravelagent
Reviews.Content: I My wife and I recently stayed at the Courtyard and the hotel was great. We were in town for a concert at Assembly Hall. The room was comfortable, the staff was very friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be where they have the flat screen TV in relation to the bed but that is a minor inconvience.I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking to stay in Champaign. The hotel is close to the free as well as numerous restraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Asian decor”
Reviews.Author: GoIllini888
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Courtyard hotel. Recently remodeled. The lobby is very attractive and has a grill/bar to grab a quick bite or beverage. Very clean. The decor is heavily Asian influenced. Nicely done, but if you dislike Asian decor, the entire hotel will drive you nuts.

Reviews.Title: “Good, servicable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghost
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Courtyard and were quite satisfied with the room. The breakfast options were nothing special, but this seems to be characteristic of the chain these days.

Reviews.Title: “It's Good - Staff was not very welcoming though”
Reviews.Author: equipe
Reviews.Content: Good room, nice and confortable. Front desk personnel unfriendly attitude, other than that, very good.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel. Cold, though.”
Reviews.Author: remerton
Reviews.Content: It was pretty much a typical Courtyard. Staff was friendly. Parking was minimal. Floors were a bit drafty, but it was also only about 10 degrees outside.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, Even Worse Amenities”
Reviews.Author: love2travel506
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 11 month old daughter stayed here while heading home for the Thanksgiving holiday. We are considering relocating to the Champaign area for my husband's job, so we were also there for business (house hunting, etc.). We were very impressed with our large, 2 room suite. The hotel was very clean and the room was pleasant. However, the front desk employees were very rude and it was obvious they did not care about "customer service." One of the big decision points for us when deciding on a hotel was to get one with an indoor pool so that we can play with our daughter. The water was FREEZING - even I as a grown woman would not get in the pool, let alone to put my daughter in it. Just dipping her feet in the pool made her body shake. We complained about this for the first 3 days of our trip, and on day 4, our last day there, the water was still the same temperature. Therefore, we were not able to enjoy the indoor swimming pool with our family, which was the main reason for picking this hotel, and it was a major disappointment after staying that long and never having our complaint addressed. We also asked when booking our hotel if they had complimentary breakfast (simple, but free). The front desk said yes. The first morning of our stay we headed to the "breakfast" area, and there was only one chef standing out there that could not speak English when we asked him a question. We sat down nad started to get our food, then an employee from the front desk came up to give us menus and get us drinks, and only after asking her directly did she inform us it was not free as expected. We were not looking for a fancy breakfast, but the basic cereal, fruit, etc. breakfast that 99% of hotels offer for free just for staying. Another BIG disappointment. Lastly, our room was on the end of the hall, so it made sense to enter through the side door vs. the main lobby. The card swiper did not work on the side door, so we were forced to walk through the main lobby everytime. We informed the front desk of this ongoing issue, and they simply replied "yes, we've had problems with that door for some time now, we recommend using the main door" instead of "absolutely, we will have someone come look at it right away and hopefully get it fixed." Again, the customer service was terrible. I was truly disappointed with my stay in Champaign, and would not recommend this place as a hotel for a long stay. If you are on business alone and do not care for anything but the room itself, you would be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Conveinent, Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boxgirl_IL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here often for work and this time there were nine of us and had very good service, especially for moving us through quickly for breakfast. Attentive and helpful front desk. Rooms look updated and as always, plent of work space. Only disappointment is having an outlet by the bed - cell phone was across the room.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayr0ad
Reviews.Content: Pleasant experience with friendly staff at check-in. My room was on the south side of the building which faced toward I-74, but the highway noise was not excessive. Rooms on the north side may be quieter however. The bed was comfortable and the AC easy to set at a comfortable level. Free wireless Internet worked fine. Good location, with many chain restaurants and shopping (Wal-Mart, Target, Meijer etc.) within a mile or so. I passed on the $8 morning breakfast, but appreciated having three newspapers available (USA Today, the Wall St. Journal and the local News-Gazette). If you stay there in the summer, don't park right under the trees that adjoin the parking lot, lest the birds use your vehicle for target practice. The price was right and the stay positive.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early May, 2009. We were pleased with the location of the hotel, just north of downtown, and easy access to the freeway. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The wireless worked well and the bed was comfortable enough. My one complaint is in direct contrast to some of the other reviews below. I found the hotel to be on the noisy side. The noise from the freeway was always present, but that is forgivable. What bothered me was that I could hear every move the tenants in the room next door made. Every time they walked across the room, used the bathroom, changed the channel...etc. The walls seemed thin and I found that to be annoying. Over all, the hotel was tolerable but next time we might try the Hilton Garden Inn downtown.

Reviews.Title: “At least the room was clean”
Reviews.Author: acc866
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member, I usually seek out Marriott properties when traveling. The Courtyard by Marriott, Champaign, IL was totally unremarkable. On the plus side, it was quiet-we never heard any noise from the many kids staying there that night. The room was also clean. The beds were among the worse I've experienced in over thirty years of extensive travel. The mattress was soft and dipped to the center from both ends. The result was you slept almost at a tilt (if you slept at all). I brought this fact up in the morning to a rather disinterested General Manager whose only comment was that the mattresses were somewhat new. Also, most Courtyards have been updated-thermostat instead of off/on for heat or air. This property has not been updated. Room was always too cold or hot. We were driving through and were not looking for anything but a clean, comfortable room. At least the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: waubonseeprof
Reviews.Content: Wow--what a great place. Very clean, very quiet in spite of it being Homecoming weekend. Great beds, great bathroom (weird shower head though) and overall excellent experience. Very nice staff. Terrific breakfast also. You'll pay more than other places, but it's well worth it to have a good night's sleep and comfortable place to stay. Strongly recommend this place if you're visiting U of I !!!

Reviews.Title: “Darn near flawless”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Damon1
Reviews.Content: Ended up in this hotel quite by chance -- our truck broke down on the interstate. Thanks to a bit of knowledge of the area, we knew better than to try to have the vehicle towed to Danville. The dealer in Champaign was catty-corner to this hotel, so the friendly tow truck driver dropped us off. I've been in a number of hotels over the years, but what surprised me about this hotel was just how flawless the experience was. The room was scrupulously clean. Water pressure in the shower was great (usually a weak flow is the norm these days, IMO). Room curtains effectively kept the light out if we wanted it. The mattresses and pillows seemed just right. Although the restaurant was closed by the time we got there, the front desk clerk was exceedingly helpful in finding some an excellent Italian restaurant that delivered. Drinks from the lounge (staffed by that same front desk clerk) were exceedingly generous. We slept well that night. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant (included in the room rate plan we had been given) was indeed a sizable spread. It had corned beef hash -- which usually isn't on the menu at places like this -- as well as made-to-order omelettes, which I've seen elsewhere. Excellent service and quality food for breakfast made the best out of the bad situation we were in. After breakfast, we went to the dealer to find out the repair news. The dealer indicated to us our truck could be fixed, but they would have to travel 30 miles to pick up a part. The front desk clerk on shift gave us zero hassles with a late check-out, given our circumstances. I spent some time in the hot tub, which seemed perfectly sanitary and well-maintained, as did the pool. When our truck was ready, the dealer sent a courtesy van over, and we checked out. It's been a while since I've had a hotel experience this flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one evening for business, and the room was just right. Clean, affordable, large, and convenient. I would stay here again. Staff was courteous and everything was as expected, if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Uniform Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Martha2020
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard, and they treat you like second class, they have a " i'm better than you" attitude. What is it with these front desk people? can't they treat their guests average??

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: aliapht
Reviews.Content: The towels smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. The bathroom was very small and had a strange smell. The room was extremely bare and the walls are thin. The bed linens in this hotel, however, were quite nice, and the carpeting appeared to be clean. The hotel appears to be in the process of redecorating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: equipesom
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, but staff was unfriendly. The free coffee in the lobby was empty.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Champaign
HotelInfo.Address: 1811 Moreland Boulevard, Champaign, IL 61820
